com.ui.table
Class ScrollableDataGrid

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JScrollPane
                  com.ui.table.ScrollableDataGrid
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener, javax.swing.ScrollPaneConstants
public class ScrollableDataGrid
extends javax.swing.JScrollPane
implements javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener

An extension of JScrollPane encapsulating an instance of DataGrid.

How To Use 

    // This is an empty list.  For all intents and purposes, imagine that  
    // the list is populated with arbitrary java beans to be displayed as 
    // grid data.
    List listData = new ArrayList();
    
    // Setup column definitions 
    List colDefs = new ArrayList(); 
    colDefs.add(new ColumnDefinition("server", "Server", 0));   
    colDefs.add(new ColumnDefinition("storeNo", "Store", 1));
        
    // Set the size of the data grid component  
    Dimension size = new Dimension(400, 175);
        
    // Create ScrollableDataGrid grid component 
    ScrollableDataGrid dg = new ScrollableDataGrid(list, colDefs, ListSelectionModel.SINGLE_SELECTION, size);
    
    // Add parent class instance which should be an implementation of ComponentSelectionListener interface      
    dg.addItemSelectionListener(this);

Author:
rterrell

Constructor Detail

ScrollableDataGrid

protected ScrollableDataGrid()
Create a ScrollableDataGrid with a default width and height of 400 by 400 and selection mode of MULTIPLE_INTERVAL_SELECTION

ScrollableDataGrid

public ScrollableDataGrid(java.util.List tableData,
                          java.util.List<ColumnDefinition> colDefs)
Create a ScrollableDataGrid initialized with a specified list of data to be displayed and related column definitions for each element included in tableData, a default width and height of 400 by 400 and selection mode of MULTIPLE_INTERVAL_SELECTION

Parameters:
tableData - a List of arbitrary objects to be associated with the table model and presented as the data grid.
colDefs - a List of ColumnDefinition objects to be assoicated with underlying JTable.

ScrollableDataGrid

public ScrollableDataGrid(java.util.List tableData,
                          java.util.List<ColumnDefinition> colDefs,
                          int selectionMode)
Create a ScrollableDataGrid initialized with a specified list of data to be displayed and related column definitions for each element included in tableData, a default width and height of 400 by 400, and the specified selection mode of selectionMode.

Parameters:
tableData - a List of arbitrary objects to be associated with the table model and presented as the data grid.
colDefs - a List of ColumnDefinition objects to be assoicated with underlying JTable.
selectionMode - a int value representing one of the following values:
  • MULTIPLE_INTERVAL_SELECTION
  • SINGLE_INTERVAL_SELECTION
  • SINGLE_SELECTION

ScrollableDataGrid

public ScrollableDataGrid(java.util.List tableData,
                          java.util.List<ColumnDefinition> colDefs,
                          int selectionMode,
                          java.awt.Dimension size)
Create a ScrollableDataGrid initialized with a specified list of data to be displayed and related column definitions for each element included in tableData, a specified selection mode of selectionMode, and a specified component size.

Parameters:
tableData - a List of arbitrary objects to be associated with the table model and presented as the data grid.
colDefs - a List of ColumnDefinition objects to be assoicated with underlying JTable.
selectionMode - a int value representing one of the following values:
  • MULTIPLE_INTERVAL_SELECTION
  • SINGLE_INTERVAL_SELECTION
  • SINGLE_SELECTION
size - an instance of Dimension.
Method Detail

loadView

public DataGrid loadView(java.util.List dataList)
Loads the DataGrid view with the list of data, assoicates the view with the model, and adds the view to the scrollable pane's view port.

Call this method when loading the view for the first time and when the need arises to refresh the view with a new list. This method takes care of repainting.

Parameters:
dataList - a List of arbitrary objects that will be displayed in the grid.
Returns:
an new instance of DataGrid

setNumericColumnSorter

public void setNumericColumnSorter(int[] cols)
Assings a NumericStringComparator comparator to every column specified in cols for the purpose of sorting String values as numerics.

Parameters:
cols - an interger array containing the column indexes that require a NumericStringComparator instance.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if a column's index is outside the range of the table's model.

addGridRow

public int addGridRow(java.lang.Object data)
Adds a row the grid's data model.

The row added to the data model is also highlighted.

Parameters:
data - an arbitrary object representing the row to add.
Returns:
1 for success and -1 for failure.

removeGridRow

Parameters:

Returns:
1 for success and -1 for failure.
